name: Xvim
body:
XVim is an open-source Xcode Plug-in that adds [Vim](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vim_(text_editor)) keybindings to Xcode.

#### Demo of Vim's auto indentation with visual mode in Xcode
![demo1](http://imgur.com/xAS5yik.png)

[Find & Replace demo](http://imgur.com/UezSflH.png)

## Installation

Installing XVim is really straight forward:

* Checkout XVim

 	`git clone git@github.com:XVimProject/XVim.git`
* Run `make` from XVim's directory.

## Tips

### `.xvimrc`

Xvim can use a `.xvimrc` file, which should be located in your `~/` directory. A simple sample file looks simmilar to a `.vimrc`.

```
i kk <Esc>
set incsearch

" Case-insensitive searching.
set ignorecase

" But case-sensitive if expression contains a capital letter.
set smartcase

" Default to global substitutions on lines
set gdefault

" Use the system pasteboard
set pasteboard
```

### `:xccmd`

XVim can access Xcode's commands by using the `:xccmd` command. You can then set your preffered commands in your `.xvimrc` file.

```
" Map <space>b to toggle a breakpoint at the current line
nmap <space>b :xccmd toggleBreakpointAtCurrentLine<CR>

" Use <space>cm to toggle comments for the selection
nmap <space>cm :xccmd commentAndUncommentCurrentLines<CR>
```

## FAQ

##### 1. Why XVim may not work on a newly released Xcode version?

Xcode releases have different UUIDs, to make **any** Xcode plug-in work, the UUID that the plug-in is using must be updated to match Xcode's. Usually this takes us less than a day, but you can also [do it yourself](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19110899/xcode-plugins-stopped-working).

##### 2. Why my key mapping doesn't work?

Maybe your key mapping is clashing with an Xcode key mapping (or even with other plug-in mapping), try to disable them to see if that fixes the issue.

##### 3. My favorite Vim feature isn't working... Why?

Check out XVim's [feature list](https://github.com/XVimProject/XVim/blob/master/Documents/Users/FeatureList.md). If you don't find your feature listed there create an [issue](https://github.com/XVimProject/XVim/issues/) so that we can work on it.

## Helping out

There are several ways to help out with XVim's development.

* Open up an [issue](https://github.com/XVimProject/XVim/issues) in Github if you find bugs, experience issues or have questions.
* XVim does also support [Bounty Source](https://www.bountysource.com/teams/xvim) in case you want your issue solved faster or just want to donate to the project.

## Authors and Contributors

XVim was created by @JugglerShu on 2012, he is the main project maintainer, he's not very picky with Pull Requests, but try to make them concise. @Goles maintains the website, so if you find anything to be missing just give him a shout.
